p: Rheum emodi Wall. Ex. Meissn. (Polygonaceae) is extensively used in both Ayurvedic and Unani systems of medicine. It has been described as having diuretic, liver stimulant, purgative/cathartic and stomachic properties (Rehman et al. 2014). Its usefulness in kidney disorders has also been reported (Alam et al. 2005). Different extracts of R. emodi are said to possess significant nephroprotective effects (Takako et al. 1984).
